revised_title: Investigation of the Colouring Matters in the Compound Ascidian Diazona violacea
tldr: The author examines the colouring matters in the compound ascidian Diazona violacea and concludes that the green colour likely results from a chlorophyll-like body, possibly due to a symbiotic alga. The study also explores the differences in pigments between the outer and inner portions of the organism.
